004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.proto.Rectangle2dProto;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.struct.Rectangle2dStruct;
010import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
012import java.util.Objects;
013
014/**
015 * Represents a 2d rectangular space containing translational, rotational, and scaling components.
016 */
017public class Rectangle2d implements ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
018  private final Pose2d m_center;
019  private final double m_xWidth;
020  private final double m_yWidth;
021
022  /**
023   * Constructs a rectangle at the specified position with the specified width and height.
024   *
025   * @param center The position (translation and rotation) of the rectangle.
026   * @param xWidth The x size component of the rectangle, in unrotated coordinate frame.
027   * @param yWidth The y size component of the rectangle, in unrotated coordinate frame.
028   */
029  public Rectangle2d(Pose2d center, double xWidth, double yWidth) {
030    if (xWidth < 0 || yWidth < 0) {
031      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Rectangle2d dimensions cannot be less than 0!");
032    }
033
034    m_center = center;
035    m_xWidth = xWidth;
036    m_yWidth = yWidth;
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * Creates an unrotated rectangle from the given corners. The corners should be diagonally
041   * opposite of each other.
042   *
043   * @param cornerA The first corner of the rectangle.
044   * @param cornerB The second corner of the rectangle.
045   */
046  public Rectangle2d(Translation2d cornerA, Translation2d cornerB) {
047    this(
048        new Pose2d(cornerA.plus(cornerB).div(2.0), Rotation2d.kZero),
049        Math.abs(cornerA.getX() - cornerB.getX()),
050        Math.abs(cornerA.getY() - cornerB.getY()));
051  }
052
053  /**
054   * Returns the center of the rectangle.
055   *
056   * @return The center of the rectangle.
057   */
058  public Pose2d getCenter() {
059    return m_center;
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Returns the rotational component of the rectangle.
064   *
065   * @return The rotational component of the rectangle.
066   */
067  public Rotation2d getRotation() {
068    return m_center.getRotation();
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Returns the x size component of the rectangle.
073   *
074   * @return The x size component of the rectangle.
075   */
076  public double getXWidth() {
077    return m_xWidth;
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Returns the y size component of the rectangle.
082   *
083   * @return The y size component of the rectangle.
084   */
085  public double getYWidth() {
086    return m_yWidth;
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Transforms the center of the rectangle and returns the new rectangle.
091   *
092   * @param other The transform to transform by.
093   * @return The transformed rectangle
094   */
095  public Rectangle2d transformBy(Transform2d other) {
096    return new Rectangle2d(m_center.transformBy(other), m_xWidth, m_yWidth);
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Rotates the center of the rectangle and returns the new rectangle.
101   *
102   * @param other The rotation to transform by.
103   * @return The rotated rectangle.
104   */
105  public Rectangle2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
106    return new Rectangle2d(m_center.rotateBy(other), m_xWidth, m_yWidth);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Checks if a point is intersected by the rectangle's perimeter.
111   *
112   * @param point The point to check.
113   * @return True, if the rectangle's perimeter intersects the point.
114   */
115  public boolean intersects(Translation2d point) {
116    // Move the point into the rectangle's coordinate frame
117    point = point.minus(m_center.getTranslation());
118    point = point.rotateBy(m_center.getRotation().unaryMinus());
119
120    if (Math.abs(Math.abs(point.getX()) - m_xWidth / 2.0) <= 1E-9) {
121      // Point rests on left/right perimeter
122      return Math.abs(point.getY()) <= m_yWidth / 2.0;
123    } else if (Math.abs(Math.abs(point.getY()) - m_yWidth / 2.0) <= 1E-9) {
124      // Point rests on top/bottom perimeter
125      return Math.abs(point.getX()) <= m_xWidth / 2.0;
126    }
127
128    return false;
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Checks if a point is contained within the rectangle. This is inclusive, if the point lies on
133   * the perimeter it will return true.
134   *
135   * @param point The point to check.
136   * @return True, if the rectangle contains the point or the perimeter intersects the point.
137   */
138  public boolean contains(Translation2d point) {
139    // Rotate the point into the rectangle's coordinate frame
140    point = point.rotateAround(m_center.getTranslation(), m_center.getRotation().unaryMinus());
141
142    // Check if within bounding box
143    return point.getX() >= (m_center.getX() - m_xWidth / 2.0)
144        && point.getX() <= (m_center.getX() + m_xWidth / 2.0)
145        && point.getY() >= (m_center.getY() - m_yWidth / 2.0)
146        && point.getY() <= (m_center.getY() + m_yWidth / 2.0);
147  }
148
149  /**
150   * Returns the distance between the perimeter of the rectangle and the point.
151   *
152   * @param point The point to check.
153   * @return The distance (0, if the point is contained by the rectangle)
154   */
155  public double getDistance(Translation2d point) {
156    return findNearestPoint(point).getDistance(point);
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Returns the nearest point that is contained within the rectangle.
161   *
162   * @param point The point that this will find the nearest point to.
163   * @return A new point that is nearest to {@code point} and contained in the rectangle.
164   */
165  public Translation2d findNearestPoint(Translation2d point) {
166    // Check if already in rectangle
167    if (contains(point)) {
168      return point;
169    }
170
171    // Rotate the point by the inverse of the rectangle's rotation
172    point = point.rotateAround(m_center.getTranslation(), m_center.getRotation().unaryMinus());
173
174    // Find nearest point
175    point =
176        new Translation2d(
177            MathUtil.clamp(
178                point.getX(), m_center.getX() - m_xWidth / 2.0, m_center.getX() + m_xWidth / 2.0),
179            MathUtil.clamp(
180                point.getY(), m_center.getY() - m_yWidth / 2.0, m_center.getY() + m_yWidth / 2.0));
181
182    // Undo rotation
183    return point.rotateAround(m_center.getTranslation(), m_center.getRotation());
184  }
185
186  @Override
187  public String toString() {
188    return String.format("Rectangle2d(center: %s, x: %.2f, y: %.2f)", m_center, m_xWidth, m_yWidth);
189  }
190
191  /**
192   * Checks equality between this Rectangle2d and another object.
193   *
194   * @param obj The other object.
195   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
196   */
197  @Override
198  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
199    if (obj instanceof Rectangle2d) {
200      return ((Rectangle2d) obj).getCenter().equals(m_center)
201          && ((Rectangle2d) obj).getXWidth() == m_xWidth
202          && ((Rectangle2d) obj).getYWidth() == m_yWidth;
203    }
204    return false;
205  }
206
207  @Override
208  public int hashCode() {
209    return Objects.hash(m_center, m_xWidth, m_yWidth);
210  }
211
212  /** Rectangle2d protobuf for serialization. */
213  public static final Rectangle2dProto proto = new Rectangle2dProto();
214
215  /** Rectangle2d struct for serialization. */
216  public static final Rectangle2dStruct struct = new Rectangle2dStruct();
217}
